description: A board smaller and more proportioned to modified two player TI.
Control what is around you for resources, and attack the center for victory points.
A more compact variant, that encourages fighting. Recommended to play with high resource values.
A flatter 3 player map without a top of the galaxy.
A competitive map with adjacencies.
Control what is around you for resources, and attack the center for victory points.
A slightly smaller than normal board which is aligned horizontally.
An smaller than normal board aligned vertically.
A smaller than normal board aligned vertically, but with gaps to encourage fights with neighbors.
A smaller than normal board aligned vertically, but filled two hyperlanes to facilitate getting across the board.
Split sides of the galaxy with many hyperlanes connecting the sides.
S more standard 4 player map, but with 4 hyperlanes to bring neighbors closer.
Control what is around you for resources, and attack the center for victory points.
The modified version of the 5 player map from FFG for use with hyperlanes.
A slightly smaller map than normal, which focuses on being closer to Mecatol Rex.
A wide map with a missing top and extra tiles on the sides.
A distinct notch separates the players at the top of the board, making their home systems still distant.
A taller 5 player map which moves one player further from Mecatol Rex.
Control what is around you for resources, and attack the center for victory points.
More adjacent home planets, with the same path to the middle.
The large version using the expansion tiles.
Control what is around you for resources, and attack the center for victory points.
The alternate map to use with 7 players which uses different hyperlanes.
Control what is around you for resources, and attack the center for victory points.
The alternate map to use with 8 players which uses hyperlanes.
